name: Nefazodone (Serzone)
summary: A serotonin antagonist and reuptake inhibitor (SARI) used for depression, discontinued in many countries due to risk of liver toxicity.
description: Nefazodone is an antidepressant that works as a serotonin antagonist and reuptake inhibitor (SARI). It is effective in major depressive disorder and some anxiety disorders but is rarely used today due to its association with life-threatening hepatic failure. It is structurally related to trazodone but has less sedative and sexual side effects.

contraindications: Concurrent use with triazolam, pimozide, or cisapride

sections.text: Blocks serotonin 5-HT2 receptors and inhibits serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake, leading to increased neurotransmitter availability and modulation of mood.

adult.titrate: Increase by 100–200 mg/day at intervals ≥1 week

sections.geriatric: Start at lower doses (50 mg twice daily) and titrate cautiously
sections.hepatic_impairment: Contraindicated in active liver disease or elevated baseline LFTs

sections.text: Improvement may be seen in 2–4 weeks; full effect in 6–8 weeks.

sections.black_box: Cases of life-threatening hepatic failure have been reported; monitor liver function and discontinue if signs of liver injury occur.
other: Avoid alcohol due to increased liver burden
Caution when combined with other serotonergic drugs

items: Baseline and periodic liver function tests

sections.pregnancy: Category C; use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in breast milk; use caution
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to side effects; lower doses recommended

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over 1–2 weeks to minimize withdrawal symptoms such as anxiety, irritability, and insomnia.

items: Withdrawn or restricted in many countries due to hepatotoxicity risk
Less sexual dysfunction and sedation than SSRIs
Not a first-line antidepressant due to safety profile
